caption: Just ordered the new braised short rib ragu pappardelle and the arugula beet and goat cheese salad along with the ricotta cheesecake. Everything was amazingly delicious! 🤘

We live in the neighborhood, travel often to Italy because my wife is from the region, and we rarely bother to review places online, but after tonight’s dinner, we had to say something. The food here is the closest you will get to eating a Mediterranean meal in Brooklyn. Homemade pasta, the right bread, all fresh ingredients, you won’t find these elements at your everyday Italian restaurant around the corner. My personal recommendation is “Risotto pescatore” ...mamma mia!
When I went here it was certainly a favorite. I enjoyed a Chicken Parmesan and it felt homemade.
Omg everything was amazingly tasty. The pasta the tiramisu. You have for to try this place. Enjoy!!!!
Holy sh1t the food was so good. Chicken mushroom risotto is so on point. Pasta was a tiny bit overcooked but the sauce was great and overall it was really great. Will def order frequently
Excellent food! Intimate space and great service.
Food was definitely the star of the show. Great little place with an old school feel. It definitely worth the trip from Queens.
Very good
This spot is great! Convenient pricing, big dishes and the staff are consistently friendly.

Piccante has never disappointed. We have been there three times and every time the food was amazing. Our recent meal was exceptional. Even though it was carry out and not as fresh as our first two times, the food was spectacular. Especially in these hard times food really gives us comfort and piccante continues to do so even in our own homes. Our steak was done just right, the brussel sprouts so flavorful, prosciutto and mozzarella - oh wow what fresh mozzarella, and lastly the pasta dishes. I hope they're doing well in these tough times. We will definitely be ordering in the future to try out the rest of the menu.

I have been holding off on this review for a while hoping things would change but it just doesn't. First I will say the food is great and that's why we keep giving the place another chance but as far as far as wait times for food its simply UNACCEPTABLE. On several occasions most recently last week I have ordered food to be delivered or picked up and have had to wait well over an hour. I understand sometimes restaurants are busy or are short staff or even have a bad day but this has happened well before covid and is still happening. Its unacceptable to put in an order to go and have to wait an hour sometimes more for it. I have worked in the restaurant business for years and every place I have worked would never allow a meal to take more then 20 minutes once its ordered and even that is a stretch. Either they need to retrain their kitchen staff or hire more employees cause if you keep making people wait hours for food you are going to keep loosing customers.
I have to say the food is amazing. Since eating there, I can never order a dish from a pizzeria. Best food!!
The best food and I love family restaurants.  Highly recommend
cozy place, good food, local walking from my home. Good service.
Make no mistake cuzzie wuzzies sent me
My favorite restaraunt in Bay Ridge, Great food reasonable prices and no frills. Just great service, great food , nice simple atmosphere
All homemade pasta. Delicious. Call ahead of time for a reservation as it's a small restaurant.

Piccante is my wife and my favorite restaurant in Brooklyn, hands down. The food there is simply amazing. We visit Brooklyn a few times a year to do a trade show. We happened upon it totally by accident, walking around looking for dinner. While standing in front of Piccante, a guy walked by us, turned around and told us that if we were looking for food that we NEEDED to go in to Piccante. “I live in the neighborhood and eat there at least 3 times a week!” he insisted. How could we argue with that?! Our minds were blown by the food. The first time we were there we ate dinner there twice in 3 days. It was that good! While the food is definitely a major reason for going, we find ourselves going back each time to experience the joy that is Marta and her family. See, this place is a small, family owned restaurant. They are sweet. They have a little daughter who sometimes is there with them. There is a palpable feeling of love in the space and in each amazing dish that comes out. The pasta is made fresh and is amazing, the spinach. OH the spinach! There’s also this butternut squash/mushroom tower thing made with a balsamic reduction. It was heavenly. We have had such a wide variety of dishes and each one is delicious. GO TO PICCANTE! That’s all I can say.
Very well kept and accessible spot. They provide large meals and for economical rates. We liked the food very much and the waiters were very personal and informative. Highly recommended.
The Napoli dish with the gnocchi is INSANELY good!
Was our first time dining at Piccante and it was oustanding.   We loved every dish we ordered as well as, Luis a a fantastic server.    Ten thumbs up!   Luis thank you for a great dining experience!
Great and friendly service,, the home made food was delicious!! Definitely l will recommend.
Obsessed. My boyfriend and I came here 3 times within one week. It was wild. We kept craving it and we ended up bringing friends and family to Piccante to eat.
This place is pretty good.
Best Italian food I ever had!
Book reservation on Saturday night. Great fresh Italian food well prepared and friendly service. Plain decor but folks pack the place for the taste not the tables.
Absolutely delicious.  The best authentic Italian food I’ve ever had.
(Translated by Google) Loved the Spicy at Spicy it was deliciously Spicy  (Original) Loved the Piccante at Piccante it was deliciously Piccante
This is our go-to place. The food is always delicious and they have great service!!
Delicious food & cozy atmosphere
very nice food and services. Fresh and professional is all I can say!
This place is great. Very homey, authentic atmosphere with mouth watering Italian dishes.
I love that place with all my heart💛 What could be better homemade pasta and desserts? Seafood risotto is my fav🥰. Try it , you will never regret👍
A friend recommended Piccante and my wife and I loved the food. Great Bolognese. Wonderful staff. We will be regulars.
Delicious pasta and the special of the day, Cornish Hen with mushroom risotto, was fantastic!
Great pollo and mushrooms risotto and amazing strawberries panna cotta!!!!
(Translated by Google) Simple Italian !!!  (Original) Simple Italiano!!!
Rude Nasty and Lazy.
All good 👍
Went while visiting my friends in late June. A wonderful restaurant with great cuisine and excellent service. I highly recommend.
My wife and I enjoy coming here! The friends and staff are great
The good and service was awesome.  Highly recommend!
Fantastic restaurant with fresh and delicious pasta. Great wine and appetizers too!!  The service is always impeccable; do not miss this neighborhood staple!!
Delicious meal! Family friendly too :)
The food is delicious and the service lovely!

This has become one of my favorite local restaurants! I am an Italian food fanatic & their food truly encapsulates the flavors of good home made Italian cuisine. They take their time in preparing the food, which is expected if the meals are prepared with dedication, however, I feel that they need more assistance waiting tables ( it gets full rather quickly!).  Nevertheless, The portions &  prices are unbeatable! The owners are friendly to add! Stop by if you have a chance, you won't regret it! :)
Simple decorations, delicious home cook Italian food, very friendly service
The staff was friendly. Small place. Food was fantastic. Homemade pasta cook to Al dente.

EXCELLENT FOOD AND SERVICE -WE HAD THE SALMON AND THE FETTUCHINO FRUITTI DI MARE . THE PLACE IS A FEEL GOOD PLACE. REASONABLY PRICED AND A REAL HOMEY FEELING . WOULD RECOMMEND .PLACE IS SMALL MABEY 8 TO 12 TABLES ..WILL BE BACK
If you like fresh pasta you will not be disappointed. Everything is very good
Great Food & Service !
Declined since it first opened. Quality of food not the same as first couple of times I ate there
Good food and nice staff! Service was slow.

Fantastic fresh homemade pasta. One of the little gems in Brooklyn where you can get more fresh homemade pasta compared to the typical big portion Italian spots throughout Brooklyn. All the pastas were amazing. The staff is insanely nice and welcoming as well. I highly recommend this place.

I went there for my birthday and was upset i chose this place. It was half empty but it seemed tight fit. The service was terrible. He checked up on us once and we were these for a long time waiting for the food. Worst part was the food. After reading rave reviews i just expected better. The calamari was average at best. The risotto was good but I do not think it was worth the hour wait time. At that point i was just starving. Cappuccino was made ok but i had better at a local coffee place. Maybe desert would have been good but i didn't want to be there for another hour waiting for it.
Fantastic food and service. It is a wonderful neighborhood restaurant. It is a happy comfortable place to enjoy a meal.
So delicious, so needed in the hood, GOOD quality authentic Italian, super friendly staff
OMG, what a gem. Totally great food and service.
Good food.
Good food but small
This place is great. A must visit and best Italian food in Bay Ridge!

My wife wanted to go to this restaurant after reading the great review this place has been getting online. We went there last week and brought our cousins as well. The restaurant has been open for a year. The location was formerly occupied by Polonica for a long time until their move further down Third Avenue. The decor at Piccante is very simple. I only noticed a couple of Italian posters located by the entrance, otherwise the place is very austere. We got there around 4pm and there was no one else there, we had the place all to ourselves the entire time we were there. Marta was our server, we think she's the owner, and she was terrific. She told us that everything was homemade. She also said that nothing was premade, so they could add or remove any ingredient we wanted. A basket of freshly baked bread was brought to the table. We all raved about the food that we ordered. My wife ordered the soup of the day and she said it was sublime. For my main course I ordered the seafood risotto, which was really delicious. A photo of it will be posted with this review. We could not have been happier with the meal and service at Piccante. Needless to say, we're coming back soon.

Little Italian restaurant that packs a lot of flavor.  The risotto was so good  you'll want a second plate even though you are full.  Good portions and price reasonable.  The Brussel sprout salad was tasty.
Everything was great, it really feels like a family and everyone was so genuine and really made the evening memorable.  Thank you, and I will be back!!!
So delicious! Will definitely be back.

Loved my experience here. Came here with my husband and baby. Everything from the apperizers to the dessert tasted awesome. Loved it so much that I am writing this review while on the way home. We ordered the grilled calamri appetizer and it was unique and tasty. Ordered the Milano pasta, and asked Marta, the owner to make it creamy and it came out just the way we like it, and hands down was one of the best pastas that I have had. The Tiramisu too was delicious. Not just the food, but also the service was very warm. Would definitely recommend this place, and will come again not once but many times.
fresh made pasta well done small place excellent prices
Food is great so much flavor lamb chops are cooked to perfection great atmosphere
Friendly family oriented Italian place. Food is amazing and so is the service!
Amazing food!! Must go!
Good food, good prices, friendly service.

A  charming, tiny restaurant where everything is homemade. If you are looking for simple food done well, this is your place. You really can't go wrong entertaining here for a few friends or just for a quiet meal by yourself. Because all of the pastas are fresh made, the menu is somewhat small, but you will like everything on it.
Amazing delicious affordable homemade fresh Italian food.
Best Italian restaurant in bayridge.. Not kidding.. Everything is home made.. Awesome place.. Service is amazing as well.. Love this place..
Good
Food was beyond fantastic.  Cooked FRESH.
This has been by far the best restaurant that I've been in Bay Ridge. On top of that with an amazing person..
Excellent ⛧
bolognese sauce is a WOW FACTOR
Awesome!!!!!

LOVE THIS ITALIAN place. My GO TO SPOT! My favorite is the Sicilian - fresh pasta with seafood! The espresso flan is so good and unique to the restaurant.  The Tiramisu is also so so good. It's been a long time since I got such a good legit Tiramisu!!

I really liked it. Small and cozy ... just stifling hot in there. Service was good. Food was good. I'd like to try it again. They make fresh pasta... I wish I could've ordered that but unfortunately I have to avoid gluten now. My husband thought his steak was overcooked. They were very nice.  Overall, we all enjoyed it. I'd recommend it, but anticipate a wait time.

Excellent service, absolutely delicious fare. Simple and understated decor. Everything we ordered received outstanding responses from our table. Will return and highly recommend. The Risotto Pescaterra and Polenta are to die for.
Amazing pasta! If I lived in the neighborhood, this would be my go-to spot for dinner. Great wine, awesome service. Eat here now!
Amazing Italian food. Pasta is homemade and delicious.

This is the place you have to try. Everything we had was very good. Grilled calamari has very nice pesto and olive oil flavor. Calamari was soft and meaty. Pescattore risotto is creamy and rich taste, but not heavy.  Scallops and salmon in risotto were very fresh. Tiramisu was light and fluffy, and not too sweet. Everything was cooked perfectly.
Gnocchi with sausage, mushrooms & pink sauce. Very good.
The food is always so delicious  me and my wife once a week
Fettuccine was amazing.  Atmosphere was warm and friendly

Its so rare for me to ever write a review, come to think of it, it might be my first. I am not a fan of homemade pasta. For the first time in my life I really loved it! , not only was it cooked perfectly but the sauce!!!😍😍😍😛😛😛. Parpadelle with spicy marinara style with chunky onion and pancetta with fresh peas!!! It was so delicious , I thought I made it! Lol... Thank you for opening this gem in my beloved Bay Ridge, it needed an authentic casual Southern Italian restaurant.

Just wow. Some of the best Italian food I've had in a while. It's not your typical, basic, chicken parm and spaghetti and meatballs type of place. Everything is freshly made including the bread and you can really tell the difference in taste. Had the "Piccante" which is pappardelle pasta with green peas & pancetta in a spicy tomato sauce. I also recommend the "Napoli" (gnocchi with spicy sausage and mushrooms in pink sauce) which I had the opportunity of tasting. The staff were pleasant and welcoming. Will revisit for sure.
Service just okay. Food was delicious. Had black linguine with chorizo and shrimp
The food was great, the homemade pasta, amazing! The staff...fantastic!
Don’t let the simple decor fool you. This place is amazing. Great homemade pasta and friendly staff. Grilled Calamari and Spicy Gnocchi were incredible!

Wow what a hidden little gem in Bayridge. From the grilled calamari to the gnocchi everything I ate was flavorful and full of character.  Best of all the pricing was surprisingly cheap.  Compared to places like Gino's looking at the menu the prices are surprisingly cheap.  You might be wondering how or why?  The answer is the entrees are actually portioned perfectly for one normal person.  Finally a meal where theres no leftovers to take home!  Btw the meal is enough food for a normal person.  Combined that with a nice and attentive staff and you got yourself a winner.
Very good down to earth place. Amazing food.
Homemade Italian at its finest. Wow. The risotto, a-maz-ing! Gnocchi, no words. Tiramisu was perfect. Highly recommend!
Great food and people, I love this new local Italian restaurant.
Everything we got was wonderful
Delicious home made food. Don't miss this place if you are in the neighbourhood.
It was bloody delicious!!!!!!!!
Such great service, wish them the best. Get their gnocchi

Family owned, very friendly people. Amazing food. Still exploring the menu. Serves the right meal proportions. Should definitely try the grilled calamari, risotto and the homemade pasta.  My new favorite Italian restaurant.
A neighborhood staple; truly authentic Italian food.
My girlfriend and I just ate at this most excellent restaurant. Very reasonable prices and incredibly delicious home-made authentic Italian food. Highly recommended!
Small place with friendly owners and AMAZING food.

I love this small family owned restaurant. I have eaten here twice: first with 3 others within the first month of its opening; second time during the weekend of April 13th for a private party of 22 people (they closed off the restaurant for a few hours to let us have a birthday brunch with a great prefix menu). So far, I have had two of their dishes (risotto with spicy Italian sausage and the fettuccine eggplant mozzarella) and I love them both. The restaurant is a small cute place with seating for 30. I love that the decorations are subtle and basic, so it is not overwhelming (I cannot do the over stimulation of colors and intense decor). I recommend this restaurant to anyone that loves Italian recipes and loves supporting family owned businesses.
Amazing homemade pasta, realistic portions, friendly owners. Great addition to the neighbirhood! We will be back!!
Good addition to the neighbourhood. Staff us super friendly and the food is on point
